item.description:
Red Tent Temple is. . . .

a coming together for women to share and follow their own heart songs.

We create sacred space, sing, laugh, cry, and connect with other women. We strengthen the "Inner Woman Voice" and reclaim the true power that lies within each of us. We remind each other what it means to be a woman through our stories, and we remember the beauty and strong support that is available in our communities.

*******

The event is from 11am to 5pm.  People arrive at different times.  In the circle, we start by sharing tea, food, song, art, and conversation.  

Sacred Circle from 3-5 is closed, only available to those who are present. Please try to arrive before 3, as the doors are locked at 3 to protect our time.

In Sacred Circle, we each have the opportunity to shine our own voice and have the experience of being listened to completely, with no interruptions, judgment, or unsolicited advice.  

*******

Please bring your shining spirit and any woman you meet to experience the pure joy of sisterhood! 

We welcome the following items to aid in creating a comfortable experience at the Red Tent:  instruments and songs, arts & crafts, tea, snacks, red items for the Red Tent (candles, blankets, etc.) and your own personal pillows/blankets for comfort. 

If you like, you can take this opportunity to dress feminine, whatever this means to you.  You are invited to dress in a way that celebrates your beauty.
item.how_to_find_us: Here are directions once you're on the farm: http://www.spiraltraditions.blogspot.com/p/directions-contacts.html
item.name: Red Tent Women's Circle
